channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX

item.title: Report X-2023110955
item.description:
Report X-2023110955

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found to be leaking on load side 1 by door 102. QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to avoid injury. DescribePack: Package was dropped onto the floor and cracked the bottom of the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to avoid injury.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking inside of a trailer. 2 IC packages listed above were sitting with one end in the puddle. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one bottle appeared dented and felt nearly empty. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was removed from trailer and placed in salvage drum. Neutralizer was used.

item.title: Report X-2023110972
item.description:
Report X-2023110972

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet at the end of the conveyor belt on load side of hub. Leakage was not spreading. DescribePack: Both plastic containers inside of the box were still mostly full but there was spilled green liquid the same color as the liquid in the bottles present. During inspection, one cap fell off causing additional leakage, revealing that it was loose. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a Hazmat bag and moved to Hazmat cage for inspection. When additional leakage occurred, box was immediately placed into a salvage drum. No spillage on the floor occured.

DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Someone bagged the leaking package and placed inside a tote box.

item.title: Report E-2023110617
item.description:
Report E-2023110617

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 21, 2023, at 1950 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of NOX-RUST® 7703-W (UN1268 PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, N.O.S., (Naphtha Solvent), Combustible liquid, PG III) from (1) 55-gallon DM. It was reported the release was contained to an area of concrete only. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors were informed that facility personnel cleaned the spill and overpacked the damaged container. All waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110595
item.description:
Report E-2023110595

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote was punctured by an unknown source likely due to inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately 12-gallons of (UN1268) Rikeizai SBS-A26 released onto the wooden trailer floor and the asphalt beneath the trailer. A Contractor responded to perform a tote transfer as well as cleanup the release. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted.

Package was intercepted by QA and damaged hazmat process began. DescribePack: leakage at the bottom of the package container. small puncture/dent DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a hazmat bag and then placed in a hazmat drum to prevent further exposure.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet when unloading from the trailer upon arrival at the facility. Package was taken to the damage area for inspection and relocated to the hazmat cage when discovered it was a hazardous package. DescribePack: One of the 4 5 liter bottles had a loose cap and was leaking. 4 Liters of liquid were spilled from that bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the damage area and placed by itself in a hazmat tote with pads inside.

item.title: Report X-2023110571
item.description:

DescribePack: PACKAGE CONTAINED 4 - 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF HIGH TEMP PHASE 1 DETERGENT ( SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTIONS) WITH LOOSE CAPS. UM1824 CORROSIVE LIQUID DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED IN A HAZARDOUS PLASTIC BAG AND TOTE AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in between van line 2 and van line 3 in a silver cage. It was wet on the side of the box when I found it there. When box and contents were inspected one of the four plastic bottles had leaked because of the loose cap and the seal that had come off of the lid. The rest are good. It was damaged on preload while being loaded into the truck. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had leaked because of the loose cap and the seal off of the top. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Bay door are open and the fans are on.

All four bottles are dented and crushed, one bottle is leaking liquid from spout opening and in some places on the body of bottle. DescribePack: There is no package failure, the package was handled or loaded/unloaded improperly. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: The leaking package was double bagged and placed inside a tote box waiting to be taken to hazmat for proper process.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The driver brought back a damaged package, it appeared to be wet, did not say what happened. I put on my large green safety gloves before inspecting the package. When opened for inspection the item inside of the package had a loose cap which caused the leak. I tightened the cap then placed the gallon and the box inside a blue hazardous materials bag then placed it in a yellow salvage drum awaiting dispostion. DescribePack: The cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The gallon had lost majority of the liquid so I tightened the cap.

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: BRITISH AIRWAYS PLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment 125-59617902 was tendered to British Airways in our Dallas Fort Worth cargo acceptance office located at 2370 WEST AIRFIELD DR STE 100 DFW AIRPORT TX 75261. Upon inspection, a number of packages contained Lithium Batteries contained in equipment that had not been declared on the shipping papers. The shipment is being held awaiting inspection if the FAA wishes to inspect. This was the second shipment with undeclared dangerous goods in two days.

item.title: Report X-2023101460

Report X-2023101460

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: HASLET
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TGBU 301802 was found leaking in the Haslet, TX yard. Upon inspection the leak was coming from the container due to 5 gallon pails that tipped during transit. A BNSF Contractor responded, found five 5 gallon pails had leaked from the lid due to the shift of the shipment. The BNSF contractor recovered the released material and secured the container for further shipment.

item.title: Report I-2023110068
item.description:
Report I-2023110068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: DFW AIRPORT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This passenger seated on 32H came to the back galley during the second break and told us one of his 3-4 batteries of his vape pen was hot and the wrapper around the battery is half way burnt. They were four flight attendants(#6.#8.#9) in the back galley including myself(#3) and we all smelled the burning odor. We took the battery from the passenger and pulled up standard procedures from manual, retrieved the fire containment bag from compartment 768, flowed the steps and sealed the bag and put it in a empty cart in compartment 972. Upon landing the bag was handed to the passenger and he gave it to people who met the flight. Captain was notified right away and everyone has been monitoring the situation. Management was meeting the flight.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Acetone Tech Grade (UN1090) was released from (1) 1-gallon plastic jug (also contaminated second jug in box) due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 5-gallon DM contains cardboard with (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs with product was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110920
item.description:
Report X-2023110920

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: PFLUGERVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package came to QA station at 5:00 AM in a hazardous materials damage tote. on a visual inspection the box was wet and there was fluid collected at the bottom of the hazmat bag. On an inspection of the contents it was found that a container of rapicide part B had leaked around 2.5 liters of its contents into the bottom of the bag. the package was further contained in a drum using latex gloves and absorbent pads. DescribePack: The container of Rapicide part B failed at its cap. The cap was noticeably loose and unfastened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the hazmat was placed in a special hazardous materials tote lined with a hazmat bag during the initial spill.
